abstracts.cdata!:
This report provides an update on
            progress made in the implementation of the Action Plan
            before the 2007 monsoon season. It describes the activities
            and projects initiated for the short term, as well as those
            being developed for the medium and longer term. This report
            highlights the major results of the first eight months of
            the implementation of the Action Plan: 1) Significant
            progress has been made to address the harsh conditions of
            the population living in the area. Direct actions to
            alleviate poverty are in place through an inclusive
            consultation process with the communities; 2) A rapid
            assessment of ecological and livelihood conditions of the
            "dhands" in the vicinity of the outfall system has
            progressed less than expected; 3) Progress has been made in
            assessing and improving local government flood management
            systems. The assessment was carried in April/May, 2007 and
            discussed with the Government; 4) Progress has been made in
            carrying out an assessment of the functionality of the
            outfall system as well as in implementing the most urgent
            repairs; and 5) Appraisal and negotiations of the Sindh
            Water Sector Improvement Project (WSIP) have been completed
            in March, 2007 and Board presentation is expected in
            September, 2007. Management believes that while immediate
            actions have been taken to address the main issues affecting
            the area as a consequence of the floods of 2003 and 2006,
            flood risks in the coastal zone of the Indus river system
            will continue to be high.
